DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type surgical procedure in which the lymph nodes are removed and examined to see whether they contain cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to surgical procedure in which the lymph nodes are removed and examined to see whether they contain cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Surgical excision of one or more lymph nodes. Its most common use is in cancer surgery. (From Dorland, 28th ed, p966):Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of lymph node dissection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of a lymph node for diagnostic purposes was not performed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Regional Lymph Node Dissection Sentinel Lymph Node

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Regional Lymph Node Dissection Sentinel Lymph Node
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in a particular anatomic region. This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in a particular anatomic region.  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.

The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

PermissibleValues.value: Sentinel lymphadenectomy followed by removal of additional non-sentinel lymph nodes
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy with Axillary Lymph Node Dissection

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy with Axillary Lymph Node Dissection
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which the sentinel node is removed followed by dissection and removal of the axillary node group.

Concepts.longName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy with Axillary Lymph Node Dissection
Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which the sentinel node is removed followed by dissection and removal of the axillary node group.

PermissibleValues.value: Axillary lymphadenectomy with or without SN isolation procedure

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax, or axilla (armpit).  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax, or axilla (armpit).  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.

PermissibleValues.value: Sentinel node biopsy followed by axillary node dissection
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sentinel node biopsy followed by axillary node dissection

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sentinel node biopsy followed by axillary node dissection
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sentinel node biopsy followed by axillary node dissection

Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else. : Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.

Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove lymph nodes found in the armpit region. Also called axillary lymph node dissection.
No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.

Concepts.definition: The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
No value exists.
Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax, or axilla (armpit).  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A staging procedure consisting of sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of the axillary lymph nodes.
